column1: Mr. Heater MH4GC 4000 BTU Radiant Propane Portable Golf Cart Cup Holder Heater
column4: ['the actual heater is great. Easy to use and works every time. Problem is with the lower portion that fits into the cup holder. Entire unit is extremely top heavy and can very easily tip out of the cup holder. The fit into the cup holder in my club car golf car is loose and poorly designed. I would not reccomend this item.', 'Have bought 3 different style heaters in 3 years to use golfing (with cart covers) and this Mr. Heater unit is the best. Regarding cost, starting ease, overall warmth, and quality construction this is by far the best heater on the market. Four players in my gaggle of friends (playing in the winter) own this unit and are thoroughly pleased with its performance and durability. If you winter golf, Buy It!', 'I last owned a Coleman brand Golf Cart Heater....it lasted about 10 years and finally died. I purchased this MH4GC unit next and it is not as good as the Coleman unit, but the Coleman unit is no longer made, so I\'m stuck with this one. Couple of issues...first and foremost, this heater is way top heavy so it will NOT stay put in a golf cart cup holder...the slightest bump and it flies right out of the cart\'s cup holder and if it lands on a person, they will get burned....I know, because it happened to me! I now have it "tied" in place with a bungee cord when I use it. No way could the manufacturer have tested this properly...my golf carts are 2017 model electric EZ Go Golf Carts. Second, there is no variable control on the heat...it\'s either wide open or shut off. I\'m not crazy about that, it does consume fuel at a higher rate than one with an adjustable propane flow valve, but you\'re compelled to live with it if you want heat. If I can find another option when this one dies, I will undoubtedly try it.', "Pretty simple to operate. Screw in 1 lb camper gas canister, press 'on' button a couple of times until it lights and you have heat. To turn it off hit the 'off' button. I ordered it for use in a golf cart.  Nothing to put together other than putting the canister into the holder and setting it into a cup holder.", "I had to ding this product because the poorly designed tip-over switch defeats the premise of the product.At even the tiniest bump in the cart path or fairway this heater turns itself off -- you will have to re-light 30+ times per round.It's a shame because it does put out nice heat and is otherwise effective and generally a fair price.The manufacturer missed the mark here.", 'Used it in my side by side this past week while hunting. Takes the rocky roads really well, the stiff north wind did blow it out a couple of times while driving around but overall it worked really well. I would recommend it and it really helps keep you warm while driving around the deer lease.', 'This heater works great in a covered cart, in fact it can get too warm, even when the outside temps  are in upper 30s and lower 40s.  In an open cart you feel the heat when the cart is stationery, however when moving or winds over 10 mph you can feel the heat.  The holder works in the smaller cart cup.Suggest they need to have an adjustable temp knob.All in all, I like the Mr. Heater portable golf cart heater.   ', "I have something similar to this in my shop, but they are bigger, but when they heat up the screens glow orange, this little one doesn't do that so I thought it wasn't working correctly. But if you do like the instructions say and make sure the pilot is lit. Then leave it alone it will start producing heat. ", "Mr. Heater that I got was brand new and worked great.  I even got it 1 day earlier than expected.  I've already used it 3 times and it has worked great!", "I read all the reviews I could find on this heater before purchase, so expected a good product.  It had to sit under the tree for a few days but Christmas morning it was installed in the cart!  It has been out on one excursion and all the guys wanted to 'ride in the warm cart'.  The hubbby is more than pleased!It sits steady in the front cup holder, is cool to the touch on all sides (well not the front of course), and works instantly!  More than pleased hubby here..........."]

column4: ["I am somewhat disappointed with this heater.  I work in a large open workspace and winter mornings can be uncomfortable with lower temperatures.  I purchased this heater with the impression that it force out a strong powerful heat.  It surely looks the part.  When I plugged it in, I realized that it didn't put out any more forced hot air than the cheap Walmart heaters. When it heats up, it does warm up an area in my house without problem, but rather useless where I work.  Its also not affective in my garage. My garage is not insulated. Again, the purpose of this heater was to have a reliable source of warm air to work in my garage.  It simply does not have the blower power that it looks to have. Its a good space heater for any room, but not  what I needed it for.  I am disappointed. These should be made with a more powerful blower.", "Pros - quiet operation.Con - gives off about as much heat as a candle.Do not recommend this product for cold applications.If the room was in the 40's (F) or 50's (F) maybe this would work.  I used it in my garage with a starting temp of 34 (F) and the coils never even glowed.  Gave off some heat but could hold me hand directly in front of the unit for an extended period of time.  Also the picture on the box showed the inner coil glowing, which gives you a sense this unit puts out some heat.  That doesn't happen either.  Would maybe use this in a office setting but not in a work shop.", 'I bought this product  because I have a moderate problem with bed bugs and I know heat is supposed to be one of the methods of killing these bugs. I have not tried using it for this purpose yet but I have used it in my bathroom to see if it would help dry wet clothes which worked well and it also helped me to see how well it heated and see if maybe if it could be a possibility for killing the bugs I have a problem with. not sure if it strong enough for this idea but works great for helping dry clothes and heat a small bathroom. I would suggest anyone trying to use it for any of these purposes closely moniter this heater and not leaving it on when leaving their home or for extended lengths of time , but it is a nice little heater and I would recommend it.', "Purchases this item because I just poker games in my garage and living in Chicago and being in the winter we needed a heater to help out during game time. I put the heater in max mode and not matter what it just wasn't throwing out enough heat.You literally have to be right in front of the heater to feel anything. I wanted something affordable that was not powered by propane however they do say u get what you paid for.", "I bought two of these for my garage and disregarded the previous reviews i read. The fan barely puts air out. It gets hot, but the fan almost seems like the motor is junk. I'll still use it. I'll just put a box fan behind it so it can actually move heat around.", "The heater is built well and is safe however its useless in a garage or outdoors. I would recommend it for use in a indoor room or basement environment where it doesn't have to compete with more harsh temperatures. Not exactly what I was hoping for!", 'This looks good in the pictures, but is a terrible heater. The forced air is a joke. Plus it does not get hot. column1: NewAir Radiant Space Heater Automatic Temperature Control Heats 40 sq. ft. 400 W
column4: ["A real case of caveat emptor. I obviously didn't lok too hard at the dimensions, as it's absolutely tiny. I grew up with electric oil-filled radiators that ran the length of a room, so find it odd it's so hard to find anything bigger of this shape. The metal seems thin, so I'm  not surprised others have complained of leaks developing. Again, I don't remember the ones I grew up with ever having a problem. It's sitting in a corner unused as I can't think where it's going to be useful. It might air the clothes in my cupboard, but as for heating anything larger, I don't see that happening.", 'It\'s in an important place in my chicken house operating very well.   We\'ll see how it does when temperature here in the American Midwest reaches 18 degrees below zero  I hae it ina small chicken house within an old milkshed that I\'m completing Styrofoam insulation, hopefully before winter sets in.  So far, the all is well with the temp down to 37 degrees a couple nights.   It is supplemented by two steady red heat lights and another thermostatically controlled heater by another manufacturer.  Meantime, pardon the ironic "sweating an expected hard winter" situation!   I do highly recommend this space heater and am sure it will work out for any close space.  Beats space heaters with hot elements hands down for safety.', 'Bought this heater in October. Have used it for a month inside a small bedroom (10 x 12 feet). Not an ideal heater for high heat needs. Eg. It helped the temp in the bedroom not drop so low that we wake up cold (was 28degF low this past week), however when set at its max heat setting all night long, the max temp inside room in the morning was 58-59F. So, not adequately warm. Our bedroom door was tightly shut and has only one window that is closed.Pros:Silent. Very light weight, so portable. Cuts off if tipped over even slightly at an angle or when knocked down to floor.Saves money on electricity!!Cons:Not adequate heating. Best heat if you stand right on top of it, between your legs :-)', 'This heater is light and slim.  It can fit in narrow spots however I would not recommend putting it in position that is close to other items.It is very hot and does NOT radiate heat like other oil heaters.  It is hot because the heat is not radiated out away from the heater.It does keep the "chill" of the bathroom however the cost of operating it may be higher than other radiator heaters.  I say this because more heat generation requires more electricity.I bought two of these and might put them in the trash because I don\'t know anyone I\'d want to bless with these ill-performing heaters.', "I was looking for a small space heater for a back room in my house that doesn't benefit from the furnace heat.  The size of this heater is great, and it keeps the room at a nice even temperature. It's nice and compact. The one drawback I have found is the legs that accompany it are plastic, and over time the heat softens them, causing the heater to lean backward or forwards, which in my opinion is unsafe since it could possibly fall over. The effect of the heat on the legs is quite noticeable. The manufacturer should consider making the legs out of a material that is heat resistant.", 'i purchased the newair portable space heater for additional heat in main room.  my first oil filled heater.  it seems to making sounds like a hot water radiator, and the surface of heater is too hot.  will donate it to local charity', 'I have this in my bathroom to help with the cold in the morning.  My bathroom is small and it heats up the room in about 15 minutes.  Hot to the touch once it heats up so keep away from kids and pets to prevent burns.  Lightweight and thin to help minimize how much space it needs once set up.', 'This is exactly what we were looking for.  We use noisy forced-air heaters in the RV to "take the chill off".  So far, this unit is great.  It keeps the whole RV about 10-degrees above ambient, with no noise.  It is just 400-watt, so it will never keep up with a 1500W \'blowers\'.It is quite compact.ONE ISSUE.  The surface gets quite hot (~ 150-deg?).  It would not be a hazard to adults (they jump back!), but it would definitely need a shield around children.', "It's great someonw makes a low wattage electric space heater for small spaces. None of the heaters we looked at went down farther than 600 watts", 'It didn\'t perform as I was led to believe it would. I wasn\'t looking for something to go under my desk, but rather, a room heater. It\'s a great heater - as long as you\'re within 6" of it - or closer. I love the thin profile and stylish looks of it. Instead of returning it, I chose to donate it to the animal shelter to either use or put into their annual yard sale which is a huge event. It will be my donation for this past Christmas (albeit late). I will get a space heater for my room some one of these days.']

column4: ["Pros-outside of unit not hot if you touch it.it's on wheels, cycles on to adjust set temperature, has a remote, has a timer, safety switches ( temp & if it tips over ). I use to do electrician work long ago, be mindful.Read all instructions thoroughly and completely! DO NOT LEAVE UNATTENDED! I still like to use this heater, in fact I own two of them. Follow all safety warnings, it can be a good heater, don't let your guard down.....be vigilant, be safe, and stay warm. I watch TV with one keeping me warm, and happy.", "Impressed with quality and many features like holding heat level economically, auto dual fan speeds, easy reading temperature, easy set up and great looking unit. Doesn't even look like a heater, more like a piece of furniture or a speaker for a high end stereo system.", 'I hen purchase several brands of infrared heaters .   Dr. Heater is built solid .  Purchased my last one in 2013.   Warranty is unsurpassed with 3 years .  Most heaters just won’t last .  Also puts our more heat output than a comparable EdenPure .   Good value and great  quality .', 'It is a hybrid infrared.  60% of the heat comes from a relatively new PTC heater.  40% comes from infrared.  It heats the air and objects in the room at the same time.  I have a small home of 1250 sq. ft.  I have three of these heaters at various places and have been able to shut my gas furnace down entirely.  Since they are very stingy on electricity, my monthly heating bill is now much less than it used to be!  I would recommend this heater to anyone without hesitation!', 'My Dr 968 1500 watt heater produces heat rapidly and cycles on and off to keep the temp where it is set. column4: ["This is the 3rd purchase of the same heater.  1st for one of my sons, 2nd for my boss and 3rd to replace a noisy old heater at my desk. Those points combined with many levels of heat to chose from and a remote control feature to boot...perfection!! It will not though as it will default to Max and if you set a temperature it reverts back to High mode which blows my Breaker! A nice design with a great oscillation feature. If you can run it on High which draws 12-14 Amps then it will work well for you! Why they disable temperature controlled operation in Low mode is baffling to me! ', 'This heater is a pretty good source of additional warmth where you need it. You may get tired of people asking you what it is though... The remote works great, (even though it is almost as weird of a shape as the heater).', "The heater is very dependable , I've had one for 1 year now. I have purchased two additional for other rooms. These units do the job of heating rooms well. They're very fashionable convenient.", 'first off gotta say this heater warms a medium size room very fast..and very wellalso easy to operate. only problem is the heater is very noise. looked over the reviewspeople said very quit very little sound NOT true loud fan and when oscillating is onmakes a verroom verroom sound [ best way to describe it]  gonna need to get out theear plugs gave it four stars for its heating', "This little heater is great for taking the chill out of the air. (Don't rely on this heater being your main source of heat but rather as a supplement).", "expertbenefitsI haven't had it too long but it fits my purpose. column1: Presto Heat Dish Plus Parabolic Electric Heater 0792401 - TESTED WORKING
column4: ["I use this heater in my clinic and my patients absolutely love it. It's amazing how quickly it heats a room without air blasting or noise. It has a nice safety feature where it makes a horrible noise if it's tipping over (it only happens if I'm moving it when it's on). In fact several of my patients have gone out and bought their own for home. I should get a commission.", 'I have an old 1911 craftsman style house with no insulation.  My heating system is an outdated oil furnace.  As we all know the price of fuel is always fluctuating and seems like it is going to stay that way.  It costs me about $300.00 a month in the winter.  Which is ridiculous, especially when the heat just does not stay in the house for long.I needed a knew plan and changing out the heat system or insulating the house is not an option at this time.  So I went out and bought the presto heatdish.  It produces so much heat that during the winter I no longer had to heat the entire house to stay warm.  I would just carry the heatdish around with me, saving me hundreds of dollars month to month.  I had a few other electric heaters before I purchased this one and the difference is night and day.I  have had this heater for almost 3 years now and it still works as well as the day I purchased it.  It paid for itself in its first week work.  With as much use as this gets I would of expected it to burn out a while ago, but that is not the case.The drawbacks: It does not have an automatic turn off system if it were to fall over, but it does have an alarm that is unmistakably loud.   There is also a footlight that you cannot turn off or on, but you can just take out the lightbulb if that bothers you.Great product and highly recommended. Thanks for reading.', "Proven, ancient technology that outperforms the daylights of newer, highly rated products. It's effective (heats the room quickly and thoroughly), efficient (only 1,000 watts), safe (automatic shut-off features), and built to last. Sometimes a product cannot be improved upon.  ", 'It gives off a good amount of heat but it has one big design flaw where the dish can not be tilted. This means the dish is in a fixed position which points into the air slightly. So if the surface you place it on is taller than you are while seated you will struggle to feel it. The safety tip over buzzer also prevents you from sliding something underneath it to tilt it yourself.', "This is a wonderful heater.  I am a smoker and visit my family a lot.  I choose to smoke in the garage there and my sister in law bought this for me to use in the garage. It warms up quickly for the immediate area and it doesn't take long for the surrounding areas to warm up either. Once this gets going I don't even need a coat.  (Ohio area)  I have a house with very tall ceilings in the master bedroom and living area.  In the winter this little heater warms up quickly, even going right to the high setting.  I always have to turn it way back too.  I am widowed now and I don't need to keep the entire house warm, just where I am.  I do recommend this.  Oh, it is safe, if you move it at all when it is on you get a loud buzz sound!  If on the fence about it I would go with it.", 'Great price, lightweight, energy efficient. It has worked very well so far. The price was the best I found on Ebay. I think the design is very good. The shape of the dish plus the shiny interior helps it be much more efficient than a regular space heater. It gets very hot very fast. It also has a buzzer in case it tips over. A great all around heater to warm a person up fast.', "These are fabulous heaters (radiant warmth, like the sun) and are in great condition.At first they didn't quite meet my needs, because I needed them to point straight ahead, whereas they are angled slightly upward and this is not adjustable. However, I set each heater on a slanted platform (which I made out of heavy cardboard), and now they meet my needs perfectly. (Parabolic heat dish heaters warm whatever is directly in front of them, within about, say, 15 feet.) You won't believe how much glowing warmth they put out!Also, Rob was great to do business with.", "I live in a 1920's craftsman style house with poor insulation. This heater is wonderful and has allowed me to turn my thermostat down several degrees and still be comfortable here in Minnesota. I would give it 4 1/2 stars if I could because it is actually a little bit large to walk around in a small house with small rooms.  But that said, even set as low as it will go, it still puts out a lot of heat. In fact, I have to be careful not to put it in a room near my thermostat because the furnace will not come on at all if I do!  I have already recommended it to friends.", 'This heat dish pumps out heat so intensely it’s like a dryer for your cloths if sitting in front of it. I could feel it’s radiant heat from about 15ft away. Wayyyy better than other heat dish I had no contest. It does not oscillate and no remote only 2 features not on this probably because it is heavy duty. This is the best heat dish, look no further. ', "I had a socially distanced bourbon tasting party for four on my back patio during January 2021 in Chicago. My neighbor had two of the Presto dishes so I ordered two more. Even though the evening's temperature dipped into the mid-20s, all four of us were completely comfortable sitting in our patio chairs with a our own Presto dish to keep us warm. The next day I ordered two more dishes to complete my set."]

column1: Heated Foot Warmer Black Cozy Toasty Toes 105 Watt 120 Volt New and Improved
column4: ["First, a Toasty Toes draws 105 watts (not 90) and is warranted for ONLY 6 MONTHS (not 1 year).OK, so the minimal warranty, particularly on this basic an item, suggests that you're probably not getting a first class product, and its shoddy factory packaging which makes you look twice to make sure you haven't gotten open-box merchandise - The tape doesn't even stick to the cardboard! - confirms it.I called the company and was told that my Toasty Toes should get to 120º on its low heat setting and 140º on high.Nope!!! I've had two of them: the first one didn't get much past 100º...went back, and the second one got to 120º, but no higher...also went back. (The high heat option may work only when the unit is vertical, but I obviously haven't been able to find out.)As far as I can tell, they're using an unique design/cute name combo as an excuse to charge WAAAY TOO MUCH MONEY for an INFERIOR PRODUCT! :(My observations about my Toasty Toes insofar as it worked: I was hoping it would compensate for a cold floor draft, but I found that in its horizontal position it warmed the bottoms of my feet while leaving the tops cold, which left them pretty uncomfortable...not at all what I had hoped for.And in its vertical position it was inadequate on its low heat setting, and I'm not about to buy a third one (Softball rules: two strikes, and you're out!) in the hope that it may actually work both as it's supposed to and as I'd like.Looks like it's back to my ancient, reliable 600 watt radiant jobby, and damn the electricity bills, full comfort ahead! :)", 'I read previous reviews of the earlier model of this item saying it did not get warm enough to feel through your shoes. (It worked OK with socks or bare feet).  That is why I bought the newer model having 104 Watts. (The box design is different than the older model.)  It does keep your feet warm even with shoes on.  (It takes a few minutes to warm up.)  It is sturdy, has two heat settings, and can be used in three positions.  (The two different pairs of legs fold out from the bottom.)  It does everything it is supposed to do.  I can not want more than that.  It has a six month warranty.', 'Actually keeps your feet warm.  I do a lot of computer work and my feet get sooooooo cold.  When your feet are warm, the rest of you stays warm.  Best with slippers.   tested with killawat tester.  97 watts at medium, 195 watts at high.  to stay warm for less than a hundred watts is a miracle.   I use as medium and have to take feet off periodically to cool down.  This is so wonderful. Thanks Cozy Products.', "The product is sturdy and works well.  It includes two legs that let it incline at a sharper angle.  The legs don't latch very well but if don't need that feature, it is very good.", 'It does the job keeping my feet warm.Would be improved if it had an automatic off after x hours and/or more than one temperature setting.', 'This is exactly what I needed for my office in the winter.Even on low I sometime need to take my shoes off the footrest to let them cool off!I have been using it two weeks and so far even forgetting to turn it off over night has not hurt it at all.', "It's made well but wow, does this get hot!  Even on low it gets uncomfortably hot - I haven't even tried the High setting.  I would not recommend this product.", 'Works as advertised. Wish the selector switch could be foot operated.', 'Bought it for my home office and it is perfect for the windy and cold corner where my desk sits.  Keeps me warm but not overheated.', 'Works as described so far, with Toasty feet !']

column1: Mr. Heater Portable Buddy Camping, Job Site Propane Gas Heater MH9BX (For Parts)
column4: ["I bought this heater for my small garage workshop. My electric heater kept tripping the breaker while using other equipment. I was afraid of other gas heaters due to their carbon monoxide emissions. This was one of the few gas heaters rated for indoor use. It also has an oxygen depletion detector and tip over cut off feature which I thought was very important.This heater silently keeps my shop warm in even the coldest temperatures and can also be attached to a 20 pound propane tank with an accessory hose ~ which I also purchased. I've run this heater for up to 6 hours uninterrupted with no noticeable fumes and since all the heat is focused out the front, it can be set close to a wall with no worries.I know I'm going to get a lot of use out of this heater. It was a very reasonable price and filled my needs perfectly. Highly recomend the Mr. Heater Buddy for heating small spaces.", 'Here in Monterey County the weather can be colder in the evenings. At my home we cut of the central heating back in ‘88 so we all dress up like eskimos to keep warm. Don’t get me wrong. We do use electric heaters in certain areas but after purchasing this Portable Propane heater, it was Heaven sent. I recommend this product with all my heart. It is compact. It is durable. It is easy to refuel. It is warm to hot. And now, as we speak, the 5 ft extension hose just arrived. When connected from my Gas Buddy to a 20 lb propane tank, I should get at least 24 hrs of constant heat. Thank you for your time. ', 'The last power outage we only had kerosene heaters.  They are big, bulky, heavy, require pouring fuel and the fumes left us wheezing and coughing.  Therefore, we found these Mr. Heater, bought two and what a difference.  Small enough to be moved from room to room and so much safer.  You will love Mr Heater.', "Small and practical for portable heat when equipped with a disposable bottle, it's even great for a more permanent heat source - just pair this heater up with a hose and a large refillable propane bottle.  It even has a pilot light for easy on and off use.  Two heat settings, 4000 and 9000 BTUs.  The back of the heater stays cool to the touch, so it can be used backed against a wall.  Six stars for this heater.", 'Really nice heater. Relatively easy to operate and has safety features. Heater will not run all night, though with the small propane cylinders. ', "Love this portable propane heater. Can't wait to take it camping. In the meantime, we use it around the house to warm up and enjoy the heat it produces. If the power goes out, we will stay warm with this heater!", "This is a very good product.  What is different about Mr. Heater compared to other small heaters is that it uses 1 lb. propane tanks, thus it does not have to be plugged in or placed near an electrical outlet.  It is easy to use and have a anti tip safety feature that will cut the unit off if the unit is tipped.  Keep on hand a few 1 lb. propane cylinders, and you're good to go.  Very good heater for small spaces and can be used indoors.", 'Great propane heater with 2 settings. I also bought a 12ft hose to connect to a 5 Gallon propane tank. The low setting was enough to warm my 29ft motor home. Perfect.', 'Purchased the additional Mr. Heater 10\' hose (item F273704) that you don\'t have to use a filter and connected it to a 20 lb. bottle of propane.   Easy to light and ran all night on low to keep my greenhouse warm.  I used a 1.5" PVC water pipe and ran the pipe under the foundation of my greenhouse and then ran the hose through it outside where the tank was located.  For safety reasons, you aren\'t supposed to have the 20 lb. tank inside near the heater.  I cut up an old wash cloth and stuck it inside the pvc pipe to keep bugs and cold air from entering into my greenhouse. So easy to do.  ', 'Product operates exactly as advertised, which nowadays is not always the case. It functions easily and simply. Really like the option to go to larger capacity tank for longer use periods or not having to change out bottles constantly.']

column4: ['This is the correct filter for using a hose with your Mr Heater. It filters oils that can come from the hose and any trash that might have found its way into hose. My old Mr. Buddys used to work without a regulator but the new one I got wouldn't even light the pilot light without the regulator.  At any rate, I'm sitting warm and Mr. Buddy is working. In a season, the heater was hopelessly clogged and useless.  These filters will prevent that from happening.
